Class LayerState

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.client.map.LayerState
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProxyLayerState, TileLayerState
public abstract class LayerState extends Object
Layer state is the rendering state for one layer on a map. Multiple layer states can share the same underlying layer for separate map components. The layer state can be made invisible and can listen for mouse actions.
Author:
Erik Engstrom, Douglas Lau

    • LayerState

      protected LayerState(Layer layer, MapBean mb)
      Create a new layer state.
      Parameters:

    • LayerState

      protected LayerState(Layer layer, MapBean mb, Theme theme)
      Create a new layer state.
      Parameters:
      layer - Layer this state is based upon.
      mb - Map bean for rendering.
      theme - Theme used to paint the layer.

    • LayerState

      protected LayerState(Layer layer, MapBean mb, Theme theme, Boolean visible)
      Create a new layer state.
      Parameters:
      layer - Layer this state is based upon.
      mb - Map bean for rendering.
      theme - Theme used to paint the layer.
      visible - The visible tri-state.

    • setVisible

      public void setVisible(Boolean v)
      Set the visibility of the layer.
      Parameters:
      v - New visibility; true == visible, false == invisible, null means automatic.

    • setVisibleForced

      public void setVisibleForced(Boolean v)
      Set a forced visibility of the layer, which overrides any manual setting (controlled with setVisible(). Layers can be returned to their previous visibility state with clearVisibleForced().

    • clearVisibleForced

      public void clearVisibleForced()
      Clear any forced visibility state.
